metadata.title: CVE-2021-43529 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Thunderbird versions prior to 91.3.0 are vulnerable to the heap overflowdescribed in CVE-2021-43527 when processing S/MIME messages. Thunderbirdversions 91.3.0 and later will not call the vulnerable code when processingS/MIME messages that contain certificates with DER-encoded DSA or RSA-PSSsignatures.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
